meanings.definition: A proctologist is a medical doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating disorders of the rectum and anus.
meanings.sent1: The proctologists at the hospital helped patients with rectum and anus problems.
meanings.sent2: I have an appointment with the proctologists next week for my digestive issues.
meanings.sent3: The proctologists joked that they had a 'behind-the-scenes' job in the medical field.
meanings.sent4: The proctologists were the detectives of the digestive system, solving mysteries in the lower body.
meanings.sent5: After seeing the proctologists, I felt relieved knowing they could help me with my rectal health.

meanings.definition: Proctologists are trained to perform surgeries and procedures related to the lower digestive tract.
meanings.sent1: My uncle had surgery done by the proctologists to fix his digestive issues.
meanings.sent2: The proctologists in the operating room were focused and skilled during the procedure.
meanings.sent3: During the surgery, the proctologists made sure everything came out all right.
meanings.sent4: The proctologists' tools were like magic wands, fixing problems in the lower digestive tract.
meanings.sent5: The proctologists' expertise in surgeries saved many patients from discomfort and pain.

meanings.definition: Many patients visit proctologists for issues such as hemorrhoids, anal fissures, and colorectal cancer.
meanings.sent1: The proctologists' clinic was always busy with patients seeking help for various rectal problems.
meanings.sent2: My friend had a successful treatment at the proctologists' office for his hemorrhoids.
meanings.sent3: The proctologists made sure to keep a close eye on any 'cracks' in their patients' health.
meanings.sent4: To the proctologists, each patient was a unique case to be handled with care and expertise.
meanings.sent5: The proctologists' knowledge and experience were crucial in detecting and treating colorectal issues.
